etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Turf, Field & Farm. From French briard, specific use as noun of briard of or relating to the Brie region from Brie, the name of a region of France + -ard

definitions: A breed of large sheepdog with a long, wavy coat that partly obscures the eyes, originally bred in France; a dog of this breed. Frequently attributive, as Briard dog, Briard puppy, etc.
